description.plain:
Keith Sweat is an R&B singer-songwriter from New York. He helped innovate the New Jack Swing genre with his first album in 1987, Make It Last Forever, which featured the upbeat “I Want Her” and the provocative title track.

Almost a decade later, Sweat found the R&B groups Silk and Kut Klose and signed them to his own record label. His fifth album, which was self-titled and released in 1996, resulted in the certified-platinum hits, “Twisted” and “Nobody.” He went on to win “Favorite Male R&B/Soul Artist” at the 1997 American Music Awards.

Currently, he hosts a syndicated R&B radio show in New York City.

songs.full_title: Right and a Wrong Way by Keith Sweat
songs.title: Right and a Wrong Way

description.plain: The album’s biggest hit was “I Want Her”, a #5 hit on the Billboard Hot 100 and the first #1 R&B hit for Sweat. The title track (a duet with Jacci McGhee) followed “I Want Her”, making the #2 R&B spot, while “Don’t Stop Your Love” and “Something Just Ain’t Right” were also major top ten hits on the Billboard R&B charts. In addition, album tracks such as “Right and a Wrong Way” and “How Deep is Your Love” received substantial radio airplay and can still be heard on quiet storm format stations. On April 6, 1994, Make It Last Forever was certified triple platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America, for shipments of three million copies in the United States.[3] The single “I Want Her” was certified gold by the RIAA on June 13, 1989, for shipments of 500,000 copies in the US.

songs.full_title: Get Up on It by Keith Sweat (Ft. Kut Klose)
songs.title: Get Up on It
songs.title_with_featured: Get Up on It (Ft. Kut Klose)

description.plain: “Get Up on It” was the fourth track on Keith’s album and it was even on Kut Klose’s album as well. This is a great duet between Keith & all the girls in Kut Klose. Keith discovered Kut Klose and opened up a door for the girls to join him on this duet, this was the girls first introduction to the world. A year later Keith would go on to produce the girls debut album as well. Group member Tabitha Duncan revealed in a interview that after the group auditioned this song for Keith Sweat and he signed them right after it.

songs.full_title: I Want Her by Keith Sweat
songs.title: I Want Her

description.plain:
“I Want Her” is Keith Sweat’s first single ever, and a track that quickly solidified him into the R&B artist he is today.

Initially, Keith and co-producer Teddy Riley collaborated on this track because Sweat told Teddy that he didn’t have enough material for the album; it was Teddy’s suggestion that the two Harlem natives worked together. They ended up writing the lyrics over the phone while Keith was working his day job at the stock exchange, helping to ignite the making of a classic album in Make It Last Forever. The duo eventually penned 6 of the 8 tracks included on the album, including the single after which he named the album: “Make It Last Forever”.

On January 30, 1988, “I Want Her” became the first new jack swing hit to reach #1 on Billboard’s R&B/Hip-Hop charts.

songs.lyrics:
Why Me Baby Lyrics[Chorus: Keith Sweat]

[Chorus: Keith Sweat]

(Why, why me, baby) Tell me, baby
You broke my heart, baby [Check this out]
(Why)

[Verse 2: LL Cool J]

We had a argument (Umm)
I didn't see you for two or three days

(I need love baby)

Tell me why
[Chorus: Keith Sweat]

(Why, why me, baby) Hurt me so bad when you left me, baby
(Why, why me, baby)

(Why) [Tell 'em what time it is]

[Outro: Keith Sweat]
I walk around talkin' to myself
Do another day gets nothin'

About each other

I'll always give all my love to you
I'm on a merry-go-round and round
Girl, how deep is your love
I've got to go outside in the rain

No, baby, no, baby, no, baby, no, baby, no, baby
No, no, no, no, no

songs.full_title: Make You Sweat by Keith Sweat

description.plain: “Make You Sweat” is the title of a number-one R&B single by Keith Sweat. As the leading single from the album, I’ll Give All My Love to You, the hit song reached number fourteen on the Billboard Hot 100 and spent one week at number-one on the US R&B chart.“ Make You Sweat” also peaked at number five on the dance charts.

songs.full_title: Point Of Christmas by Keith Sweat
songs.title: Point Of Christmas

description.plain: This song serves as a reminder to everyone in the modern times that Christmas is about one thing, Christmas is about celebrating Christ, not expensive gifts, Sweat wants to emphasize that there is no gift greater than that of the birth of Jesus of Nazareth.
